channel.title: Blog on The Weekly Challenge
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on The Weekly Challenge

item.title: Advent Calendar - December 1, 2024
item.description: Advent Calendar 2024 | Day 1 | The gift is presented by Dave Jacoby. Today he is talking about his solution to The Weekly Challenge - 250. This is re-produced for Advent Calendar 2024 from the original post. Leaping from Tree to Tree as They Float Down the Mighty Rivers of British Columbia Happy New Year to those who celebrate! Here we are at Weekly Challenge #250! 250 is 2 * 53, and has the same digits as prime factors.

item.title: Advent Calendar 2024
item.description: | 2019 | 2020 | 2021 | 2022 | 2023 | 2024 | Welcome to our 6th Advent Calendar. It doesn’t look real to be very honest, coming this far is a collective efforts of every Team PWC members. MON TUE WED

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - Guest Contributions
item.description: As you know, The Weekly Challenge, primarily focus on Perl and Raku. During the Week #018, we received solutions to The Weekly Challenge - 018 by Orestis Zekai in Python. It was pleasant surprise to receive solutions in something other than Perl and Raku. Ever since regular team members also started contributing in other languages like Ada, APL, Awk, BASIC, Bash, Bc, Befunge-93, Bourne Shell, BQN, Brainfuck, C3, C, CESIL, Chef, COBOL, Coconut, C Shell, C++, Clojure, Crystal, D, Dart, Dc, Elixir, Elm, Emacs Lisp, Erlang, Excel VBA, F#, Factor, Fennel, Fish, Forth, Fortran, Gembase, GNAT, Go, GP, Groovy, Haskell, Haxe, HTML, Hy, Idris, IO, J, Janet, Java, JavaScript, Julia, K, Korn Shell, Kotlin, Lisp, Logo, Lua, M4, Maxima, Miranda, Modula 3, MMIX, Mumps, Myrddin, Nelua, Nim, Nix, Node.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 296
item.description: TABLE OF CONTENTS 01. HEADLINES 02. STAR CONTRIBUTORS 03. CONTRIBUTION STATS 04. GUESTS 05. LANGUAGES 06. CENTURION CLUB 07. DAMIAN CONWAY’s CORNER 08. ANDREW SHITOV’s CORNER 09. PERL SOLUTIONS 10. RAKU SOLUTIONS 11. PERL & RAKU SOLUTIONS HEADLINES Thank you Team PWC for your continuous support and encouragement. STAR CONTRIBUTORS Following members shared solutions to both tasks in Perl and Raku as well as blogged about it.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 297
item.description: TABLE OF CONTENTS 01. HEADLINES 02. SPONSOR 03. RECAP 04. PERL REVIEW 05. RAKU REVIEW 06. CHART 07. NEW MEMBERS 08. GUESTS 09. TASK #1: Contiguous Array 10. TASK #2: Semi-Ordered Permutation HEADLINES Welcome to the Week #297 of The Weekly Challenge. Welcome back, Adam Russell and thanks for catching up with last week solutions in Perl and Prolog alongwith bonus blog post. Just one week left before the Advent Calendar kicks in.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 296
item.description: TABLE OF CONTENTS 01. HEADLINES 02. SPONSOR 03. RECAP 04. PERL REVIEW 05. RAKU REVIEW 06. CHART 07. NEW MEMBERS 08. GUESTS 09. TASK #1: String Compression 10. Over the last couple of weeks, I’ve noticed a slightly slower pace of participation.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 295
item.description: TABLE OF CONTENTS 01. HEADLINES 02. SPONSOR 03. RECAP 04. PERL REVIEW 05. RAKU REVIEW 06. CHART 07. NEW MEMBERS 08. GUESTS 09. TASK #1: Word Break 10. TASK #2: Jump Game HEADLINES Welcome to the Week #295 of The Weekly Challenge. Welcome back, Jorg Sommrey and thanks for sharing solutions to Week #290, Week #291, Week #292, Week #293 and Week #294. It is always pleasure to see contributions to past challenges.

item.title: Multiple Inheritance vs Role
item.description: In the world of Perl, we all believe in this philosophy for Multiple Inheritance in general: Don’t use multiple inheritance if you can do it in any other way. To address this, there is a general consensus to use roles. Personally, I have never had to deal with multiple inheritance. Being a big fan of roles, I want to simplify the comparison for my own understanding. With the inclusion of Corinna in core Perl v5.
